term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - rain out in atmospheric chemistry
term.title: rain out

item.text: The mechanism by which small particles in the clouds are removed by the formation of raindrops; this is a different mechanism from wash out which is a process which occurs below cloud level. Both the terms rain out and wash out have not always been used in accordance with these definitions. For clarity they should be replaced by the terms, in-cloud scavenging and below-cloud scavenging, respectively.

item.title: scavenging (in atmospheric chemistry) (in radiation chemistry, in radiochemistry, in atmospheric chemistry)
